thread.title: Alabama native Madeline Mitchell Gwin is Mrs. America 2015
thread.title_full: Alabama native Madeline Mitchell Gwin is Mrs. America 2015

author: Tamika Moore | tmoore@al.com
title: Alabama native Madeline Mitchell Gwin is Mrs. America 2015
text:
Comments 
Just one week into her reign, the new Mrs. America is already preparing for a big trip to China. 
Mrs. Alabama America 2015, Madeline Mitchell Gwin, 26, was crowned Mrs. America 2015 in Las Vegas Sept. 24, earning her the opportunity to represent the United States in the Mrs. World 2015 competition in Bejing. 
The Mrs. America competition is one of the oldest pageants for married women and it is supported with a director in every state and the District of Columbia. It is not related to the Miss Universe or Miss America organizations. The pageant "celebrates today's married woman," according to Rhonda Gilliam, Mrs. Alabama America's executive director. 
As part of their Mrs. America duties, titleholders spend time speaking about causes important to them. Gwin's is overcoming obstacles because she survived a bad car accident according to Gilliam. "She was told she may never walk again," she said. 
Gwin recovered and will share her story of determination with others as she makes appearances all over the country. She hopes to encourage others to never give up. "She has really overcome a lot in her life and she just wants to share with others that they can do the same," Gilliam said. 
Gwin, a University of Alabama graduate, is no stranger to the new spotlight on her life. She was crowned Miss Alabama USA 2011 and was named the second runner-up in the 2011 Miss USA pageant. (She later crowned Katherine Webb McCarron, Miss Alabama USA 2012, her successor.) 
In 2013, she competed on NBC's "Get Out Alive with Bear Grylls" with then fiancé Ryan. The show was an adventure reality series that pitted 10 teams of two against each other to survive in the wilds of New Zealand. The two are now married and raising their infant son in Mobile. 
Gwin is the fourth Mrs. Alabama to be named Mrs. America. She will crown Candace Schmersahl, of McCalla, as the new Mrs. Alabama America 2015 in an upcoming ceremony. Schmersahl will assume the duties of Mrs. Alabama until the the new Mrs. Alabama is crowned on March 26 at Indian Springs Town Hall. 
Watch below as actress Florence Henderson names Gwin as Mrs. America 2015. One of the most amazing moments in my life... I give all the glory to my... https://t.co/A54RP50zJO — Madeline Gwin (@MadelineALUSA11) September 27, 2015 CONGRATULATIONS to Madeline Grace Mitchell Gwin, Miss Alabama USA 2011 our new Mrs. America!!!! http://t.co/GVKEwCjRle
